Integration_System__Audited_Object.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Integration_System__Audited_ObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Integration_System__Audited_Object.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Integration_System__Audited_Object.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: The password does not meet password requirements.

Integration_System_User_Data.description: The system should generate a random password for the user.
The user will be required to change their password upon initial sign on.
The amount of time after which an unused session will expire. Session Timeout Minutes defaults to the value configured in the Password Rules unless set to a non-zero value.

validation.validation: Session Timeout Minutes must be greater than 5 and less than or equal to [max]. The default value is [default].

Integration_System_User_Data.description: This field allows restricting integration system user accounts from signing in to Workday in the user interface (UI). Integration system accounts should only be used for web service integrations.If the field is true, the integration system user will not be able to sign in to the UI, but will still be able to make web service requests.If the field is false, the integration system user will be able to sign in from both the UI and through web services.

Web_Service_Security_Configuration_Data.description: Indicates if WS-Security x509 Certificate Token Profile authentication is enabled.

x509_Public_KeyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

x509_Public_KeyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

x509_Public_KeyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Web_Service_Security_Configuration_Data.description: x509 Encryption Certificate used to sign requests

validation.validation: X509 Public Key is required when X509 Token Authentication is enabled.

Web_Service_Security_Configuration_Data.description: Indicates if WS-Security SAML Token Profile authentication is enabled.
Unique identifier of the SAML identity provider.

validation.validation: An identifier of the SAML Identity Provider is required when SAML authentication is enabled.

Web_Service_Security_Configuration_Data.description: x509 Encryption Certificate of the holder-of-key. This key is used to verify the signature of the inbound SOAP message.

Integration_System_User_Data.description: A valid instance of Web Service Security Configuration

validation.validation: Either setting X509 Token Authentication or SAML Token Authentication is required when setting up a new Web Service Security Configuration.   If neither of these options is set, this element data is not required.
validation.description: This validation requires user to set either X509 Token Authentication or SAML Token Authentication when setting up a new Web Service Security Configuration.

validation.validation: System User to be assigned to an Integration System must not be a Worker or Implementer, nor may it already be associated with a different Integration System.  Either choose another System User or create a new one.
validation.description: System User to be assigned to an Integration System must not be a Worker or Implementer, nor may it already be associated with a different Integration System.  Either choose another System User or create a new one.

validation.validation: Password is required when creating a new Workday Account.
validation.description: Password is required when creating a new Workday Account.
